subject: RE: New FAQ item? (Re: [junit] Textui.TestRunner regarding)
messageBody:
Sounds good!

Scott Stirling

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Mike Clark [mailto:mike@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, July 23, 2002 5:56 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: New FAQ item? (Re: [junit] Textui.TestRunner regarding)
>
>
> J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>
> >Maybe this should be a FAQ item, if not already: common
> mistakes when
> >running the samples. Perhaps a polite reference to a tutorial
> >explaining what CLASSPATH is would be nice.
> >
>
> How's this work for ya?
>
> ----
>
> Why do I get a NoClassDefFoundError when trying to test JUnit
> or run the
> samples?
>
> (Submitted by: J.B. Rainsberger and Jason Rogers)
>
> Most likely your CLASSPATH doesn't include the JUnit installation
> directory.
>
> Consider running WhichJunit
> <http://www.clarkware.com/software/WhichJUnit.zip> to print
> the absolute
> location of the JUnit class files required to run and test
> JUnit and its
> samples.
>
> If the CLASSPATH seems mysterious, read this
> <http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4/docs/tooldocs/findingclasses.html> !
